classes.title: GOVT660
classes.subtitle: Municipal Administration.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course covers municipal government organization and management, finance, personnel, planning and economic development, and the administration of specific municipal functions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT661
classes.subtitle: County Administration.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course covers municipal government organization and management, finance, personnel, planning and economic development, and the administration of specific municipal functions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT661
classes.subtitle: County Administration.  4 Credits.
classes.description: This course covers county government organization and management, finance, personnel, planning, and economic development, and the administration of specific municipal functions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT662
classes.subtitle: Information Technology Project Management and Leadership.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course covers county government organization and management, finance, personnel, planning, and economic development, and the administration of specific municipal functions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT662
classes.subtitle: Information Technology Project Management and Leadership.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Examines the public sector environment as it relates to information technology development. Special attention focused on the complex environment and its influence on information technology-based solutions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT663
classes.subtitle: Public Executive Leadership Academy.  6 Credits.
classes.description: Examines the public sector environment as it relates to information technology development. Special attention focused on the complex environment and its influence on information technology-based solutions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT663
classes.subtitle: Public Executive Leadership Academy.  6 Credits.
classes.description: The Public Executive Leadership Academy is designed for North Carolina city and county managers to understand themselves as leaders and to prepare the organization to work with others in improving the quality of life within the community.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT664
classes.subtitle: Chief Information Office Certification Program.  5 Credits.
classes.description: The Public Executive Leadership Academy is designed for North Carolina city and county managers to understand themselves as leaders and to prepare the organization to work with others in improving the quality of life within the community.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT664
classes.subtitle: Chief Information Office Certification Program.  5 Credits.
classes.description: The CIO Certification Program is designed for chief information officers of local governments in North Carolina. The course lays the foundation for addressing the most critical issues facing IT leadership in local government and equips leaders with tools to manage and improve their organizational assets.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT772
classes.subtitle: Local Government in North Carolina.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The CIO Certification Program is designed for chief information officers of local governments in North Carolina. The course lays the foundation for addressing the most critical issues facing IT leadership in local government and equips leaders with tools to manage and improve their organizational assets.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: GOVT772
classes.subtitle: Local Government in North Carolina.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The purpose of this course is to familiarize students with the purpose, structure, and function of local governments in North Carolina. At the course's conclusion, students should be able to identify and discuss the operation and governance structure of North Carolina counties and municipalities. Moreover, students should develop a reasonably comprehensive framework to analyze and understand the legal, cultural, and political environments of the various regions throughout the state. Lead for North Carolina Participants Only.Grading status: Letter grade.
